New Records: The Los Angeles Dodgers became the first team to come back from a five-run deficit in a World Series clinching game.
Walker Buehler set a World Series record by becoming the second pitcher to both start and save a clinching game.
Key Match Events: Aaron Judge and Jazz Chisholm Jr. hit back-to-back home runs in the first inning.
The Dodgers tied the game in the fifth inning with five unearned runs due to Yankees' errors.
Mookie Betts, Freddie Freeman, and Teoscar Hern√°ndez drove in RBI hits.
The Yankees led 6-5 in the sixth inning before the Dodgers took the lead in the eighth.
Gavin Lux and Mookie Betts hit sacrifice flies to win the game.
Pre-Game Insights: The Yankees were aiming to end a 28-year championship drought.
The Dodgers had the most regular-season wins in 2024.
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Boone expressed frustration over the loss.
Shohei Ohtani finished the series with a.105 batting average.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Yankee Stadium with 49,263 attendees.
The Dodgers won their eighth World Series title.
The Dodgers and Yankees have met 12 times in the World Series, the most frequent matchup.
